verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>

"Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my vexation <S%H9213><s%> were actually <S%H8254><s%> weighed, <S%H8254><s%> And laid <S%H5375><s%> in the balances <S%H3976><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> with my iniquity! <S%H1942><s%>

"For then <S%H6258><s%> it would be heavier <S%H3513><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> have been <S%H9236><s%> rash. <S%H9236><s%>

"For the arrows <S%H2671><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> are within <S%H5973><s%> me; Their poison <S%H2534><s%> my spirit <S%H7307><s%> drinks; <S%H8354><s%> The terrors <S%H1161><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> are arrayed <S%H6186><s%> against me.

"Does the wild <S%H6501><s%> donkey <S%H6501><s%> bray <S%H5101><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> [his] grass, <S%H1877><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> does the ox <S%H7794><s%> low <S%H1600><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> his fodder <S%H1098><s%>?

"Can something <S%H8602><s%> tasteless <S%H8602><s%> be eaten <S%H398><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> salt, <S%H4417><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> is there <S%H3426><s%> any <S%H3426><s%> taste <S%H2940><s%> in the white <S%H2495><s%> of an egg <S%H2495><s%>?
"My soul <S%H5315><s%> refuses <S%H3985><s%> to touch <S%H5060><s%> [them;] They are like loathsome <S%H1741><s%> food <S%H3899><s%> to me.
"Oh <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that my request <S%H7596><s%> might come <S%H935><s%> to pass, <S%H935><s%> And that God <S%H433><s%> would grant <S%H5414><s%> my longing! <S%H8615><s%>
"Would that God <S%H433><s%> were willing <S%H2974><s%> to crush <S%H1792><s%> me; That He would loose <S%H5425><s%> His hand <S%H3027><s%> and cut <S%H1214><s%> me off! <S%H1214><s%>

"But it is still <S%H5750><s%> my consolation, <S%H5165><s%> And I rejoice <S%H5539><s%> in unsparing <S%H3808><s%> <S%H2550><s%> pain, <S%H9133><s%> That I have not denied <S%H3582><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One. <S%H6918><s%>
"What <S%H4100><s%> is my strength, <S%H3581><s%> that I should wait <S%H3176><s%>? And what <S%H4100><s%> is my end, <S%H7093><s%> that I should endure <S%H748><s%> <S%H5315><s%>?
"Is my strength <S%H3581><s%> the strength <S%H3581><s%> of stones, <S%H68><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> is my flesh <S%H1320><s%> bronze <S%H5153><s%>?
"Is it that my help <S%H5833><s%> is not within me, And that deliverance <S%H8454><s%> is driven <S%H5080><s%> from me?

"For the despairing <S%H4523><s%> man <S%H4523><s%> [there should be] kindness <S%H2617><s%> from his friend; <S%H7453><s%> Lest he forsake <S%H5800><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Almighty. <S%H7706><s%>
"My brothers <S%H251><s%> have acted <S%H898><s%> deceitfully <S%H898><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> a wadi, <S%H5158><s%> Like the torrents <S%H650><s%> of wadis <S%H5158><s%> which vanish, <S%H5674><s%>
Which are turbid <S%H6937><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of ice, <S%H7140><s%> [And] into which the snow <S%H7950><s%> melts. <S%H5956><s%>
"When <S%H6256><s%> they become <S%H2215><s%> waterless, <S%H2215><s%> they are silent, <S%H6789><s%> When it is hot, <S%H2552><s%> they vanish <S%H1846><s%> from their place. <S%H4725><s%>
"The paths <S%H734><s%> of their course <S%H1870><s%> wind <S%H3943><s%> along, <S%H3943><s%> They go <S%H5927><s%> up into nothing <S%H8414><s%> and perish.
"The caravans <S%H734><s%> of Tema <S%H8485><s%> looked, <S%H5027><s%> The travelers <S%H1979><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> hoped <S%H6960><s%> for them.
"They were disappointed <S%H954><s%> for they had trusted, <S%H982><s%> They came <S%H935><s%> there <S%H5704><s%> and were confounded. <S%H2659><s%>
"Indeed, <S%H3588><s%> you have now <S%H6258><s%> become <S%H1961><s%> such, <S%H3808><s%> You see <S%H7200><s%> a terror <S%H2866><s%> and are afraid. <S%H3372><s%>
"Have I said, <S%H559><s%> 'Give <S%H3051><s%> me [something,'] Or, 'Offer <S%H7809><s%> a bribe <S%H7809><s%> for me from your wealth, <S%H3581><s%>'
Or, 'Deliver <S%H4422><s%> me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the adversary, <S%H6862><s%>' Or, 'Redeem <S%H6299><s%> me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the tyrants <S%H6184><s%>'?
"Teach <S%H3384><s%> me, and I will be silent; <S%H2790><s%> And show <S%H995><s%> me how <S%H4100><s%> I have erred. <S%H7686><s%>
"How <S%H4100><s%> painful <S%H4834><s%> are honest <S%H3476><s%> words! <S%H561><s%> But what <S%H4100><s%> does your argument <S%H3198><s%> prove <S%H3198><s%>?
"Do you intend <S%H2803><s%> to reprove <S%H3198><s%> [my] words, <S%H561><s%> When the words <S%H4405><s%> of one in despair <S%H2976><s%> belong to the wind <S%H7307><s%>?
"You would even <S%H637><s%> cast <S%H5307><s%> [lots] for the orphans, <S%H3490><s%> And barter <S%H3739><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> your friend. <S%H7453><s%>
"And now <S%H6258><s%> please <S%H2974><s%> look <S%H6437><s%> at me, And [see] if <S%H518><s%> I lie <S%H3576><s%> to your face. <S%H6440><s%>
"Desist <S%H7725><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> let there be no <S%H408><s%> injustice; <S%H9390><s%> Even desist, <S%H7725><s%> my righteousness <S%H6664><s%> is yet <S%H5750><s%> in it.
"Is there <S%H3426><s%> injustice <S%H9390><s%> on my tongue <S%H3956><s%>? Cannot <S%H3808><s%> my palate <S%H2441><s%> discern <S%H995><s%> calamities <S%H1942><s%>?
